Name: Douglas College Food Bank
Description: Provides food bank services for Douglas College students.

Name: Ecole Qayqayt Elementary School - Hot Lunch Program
Description: Provides an in-house hot lunch program for Ecole Qayqayt Elementary School Students (grades K-7).

Name: Holy Trinity Anglican Cathedral - Breakfast Program
Lord Kelvin Elementary School - Hot Lunch Program
Description: Provides an in-house hot lunch program for Lord Kelvin Elementary School Students (grades K-7).

Name: Port Royal Community Garden
Description: New Westminster residents can grow food in a community garden in Port Royal. Actual community garden is located in Port Royal Park (near Star Crescent); location shown is just the administrative location. There are other community gardens in New Westminster, with more information available on the New Westminster Parks and Rec Society website (http://www.newwestpcr.ca/parks/park_amenities/community_gardens.php).

Name: Pregnancy Outreach Programs - Olivet Baptist Church
Description: These programs assist pregnant women and their infants who need extra help and support. Programs may provide weekly lunches, food vouchers and prenatal vitamins. Program provided through Burnaby Family Life Institute.
Hours: Tuesday, 10:30 am - 1:00 pm for moms and babies up to 6 months, Tuesday, 12:00 pm - 2:30 pm for pregnant women

Name: Queen Elizabeth Elementary School - Hot Lunch Program
Description: Provides an in-house hot lunch program for Queen Elizabeth Elementary School Students (grades K-4).

Name: Queens Avenue United Church - Community Lunch
Queensborough Middle School - Hot Lunch Program
Description: Provides an in-house hot lunch program for Queensborough Middle School Students (grades 5-8).

Name: Saint Barnabas Anglican Church- Community Meal and Food Cupboard Programs
Description: Community meal provides lunch and is open to all. Food cupboard program provides emergency food hampers for a couple of meals.
Hours: Community Meal: Thursday, 11:00 am, Emergency Food Cupboard: Friday, 10:00 am-12:00 pm

Name: Salvation Army - Community Lunch and Food Programs
Description: Community lunch program. Drop in food program (free bread), emergency food rations available by appointment. Also has a produce day program.
Hours: Emergency food program: Monday-Friday, 10:00 am - 12:00 pm (by appointment). Saturday Brunch: Saturday, 10:00 am. Sunday meal program: Sunday, 12:30 pm, Produce day program: Wednesday, 1:00 pm

Name: Spirit of the Children Society - Traditional Kitchen for Aboriginal Families and Youth
Description: Create a meal together in positive environment, share and learn recipes, learn how to shop for foods on a budget, learn about healthy eating habits, and experience traditional Aboriginal foods.

Name: Union Gospel Mission
Hours: Breakfast Service: Monday-Friday, 8:30 am - 9:30 am, Soup Service: Monday-Friday, 11:15 am - 12:00 pm
